intro: Marilaunidium serpyllodes, commonly known as common sandmat, is a low-growing annual plant native to the Mediterranean region. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes many aromatic herbs. The plant has a mat-forming habit with small, spoon-shaped leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. Its flowers are small and white, arranged in umbels, typical of the carrot family. It thrives in sandy or gravelly soils and is often found in disturbed habitats.
